com.bluecraft.hmm.util
Class LookFeel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bluecraft.hmm.util.LookFeel
public class LookFeel
extends java.lang.Object
implements LookFeelList

LookFeel is a helper class to easily set and manipulate LookAndFeel of Java classes. Names of LookAndFeel are defined in LookFeelList. This code is adapted from Sun's Java on-line tutorials.

Version:
0.3
Author:
Hyoungsoo Yoon

Method Summary
static void changeLF(java.awt.Component topComponent, java.lang.String lnf)
          Changes the LookAndFeel for a class derived from Component.
static void initializeLF()
          Initializes the LookAndFeel to default (Metal).
static void initializeLF(java.lang.String lnf)
          Initializes the LookAndFeel.
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
          This function is provided for testing purposes.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

initializeLF

public static void initializeLF()
Initializes the LookAndFeel to default (Metal).

initializeLF

public static void initializeLF(java.lang.String lnf)
Initializes the LookAndFeel.
Parameters:
lnf - Name of the LookAndFeel to be set.

changeLF

public static void changeLF(java.awt.Component topComponent,
                            java.lang.String lnf)
Changes the LookAndFeel for a class derived from Component.
Parameters:
topComponent - Name of the component whose LookAndFeel should be changed.
lnf - Name of the new LookAndFeel.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This function is provided for testing purposes. First, it sets the name of the LookAndFeel, then initializes the LookAndFeel, and finally creates a simple JFrame with this LookAndFeel. No error checking is done.
